author: Staff Reporter
text:
Two new classrooms at the Government Higher Secondary School in Vellaiyampatti village constructed jointly through Tamil Nadu Government’s Self Sufficiency Scheme (SSS) and the National Service Scheme (NSS) unit of The American College were inaugurated on Monday.

The classrooms were inaugurated by M. Davamani Christober, Principal of The American College, and C. Samuel Chelliah, NSS Regional Director (Chennai).

S.C.B. Samuel Anbu Selvan, NSS Programme Officer, said that the village had been adopted by the NSS unit of the college. He said that while Rs 9.4 lakh of the Rs. 14.1 lakh project cost came from SSS, the remaining Rs. 4.7 lakh was raised from college alumni.
title: Classrooms opened
